div.p: Nash Ang is an award-winning filmmaker, cultural bridge-builder, and ecosystem architect dedicated to shaping meaningful connections between Korea and the Philippines through media and innovation. He holds a Master of Fine Arts degree from the prestigious Korea National University of Arts. Guided by a passion for people and purpose, Nash creates inspiring, human-centered projects that unite storytelling, technology, and design—powered by data-driven creativity and intelligent automation.

As a filmmaker, he gained international recognition early in his career, winning the Grand Prize at the ASEAN-Korea Multimedia Competition 2010 in South Korea for his debut film. His bold vision later earned him the Best Director Award at the 13th Pyongyang International Film Festival in North Korea—an extraordinary achievement highlighting the power of art to transcend borders.

Beyond filmmaking, Nash champions cross-cultural understanding and creative empowerment. In 2022, he was honored with the Media Advocacy Award by the Commission on Filipinos Overseas, recognizing his efforts to uplift Filipino artistry and voices on the global stage. Through his work, Nash continues to build ecosystems where creativity, culture, and technology come together to create lasting social impact.

div.h6: Nash Ang is a visionary film director, cinematographer, and performer who continues to bridge cultures through the art of cinema. As an actor, he has appeared in several acclaimed Korean dramas and films, including Cheoyong, Mama Fairy and the Woodcutter, and The Running Mates: Human Rights. In Arthdal Chronicles, Nash made a remarkable mark in Korean entertainment history by introducing native Filipino languages into the dialogue of main actors—an inspiring step toward cultural inclusion and authentic representation of Filipinos on the global screen.

div.span: Explore my stories and insights on Medium, where I share reflections on creativity, culture, and collaboration.

If you’d like to discuss work, partnerships, or media-related opportunities, you can reach me directly at nash@pinoyseoul.com. For everything else—conversations, inspiration, or simply to connect—feel free to follow or message me on LinkedIn, Instagram, or Facebook. Let’s build stories that bridge worlds.
